samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began developing R in the early 1990s (around 1991-1993), and the first version was released in 1995. R was designed as an implementation and extension of the S programming language, which was developed at Bell Laboratories. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names (Ross and Robert).

The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names (Ross and Robert).

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of the R statistical computing language, which had been in development since the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of the R statistical computing language, which had been in development since the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
